intro: Silene hookeri subsp. pulverulenta, commonly known as the dusty silene, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its small, pale pink to white flowers and hairy, glandular leaves that give it a dusty appearance. This species thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant is part of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. Its unique morphology and habitat preferences make it a distinctive species within its ecological niche.
